question: Question_01_(a)
sols:
Given the function

\[\displaystyle f(x,y) = 8x^{1/5} y^{4/5}\] We can compute each of
$f(2x,2y)$ and $2f(x,y)$.

\begin{align*} f(2x,2y) &= 8 (2x)^{1/5} (2y)^{4/5} \\ &= 8(2)^{1/5+4/5} x^{1/5} y^{4/5} \\&= 16 x^{1/5}y^{4/5}\end{align*}

and

\begin{align*}2f(x,y) &= 2(8x^{1/5}y^{4/5}) \\&= 16 x^{1/5}y^{4/5}\end{align*}

And so we obtain that

\[\displaystyle f(2x,2y)-2f(x,y) = 0\]
